result.execSummary:
The defendant David James Pepper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David James Pepper is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David James Pepper was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • David James Pepper was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • David James Pepper was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 08:02 AM - Attorney Jennifer Gross appeared by phone means for Defendant David James Pepper. Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Defendant David James Pepper appeared by phone means (fr ACJ).  COVID - ZOOM; agreemt, def accepts probation, VRL/complied.  SENT:  see Pge 2

Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia.
Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there.
  Defendant is to have NO CONTACT with N.K., M.P.
  Defendant is to have NO CONTACT with 75781 Pohl Rd

Sentencing hearing on June 30, 2021 at 08:00 am.

01:01 PM Defendant David James Pepper in court from ACJ via phone with attorney Jennifer Gross appearing via phone. Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All warrants cancelled. Address: 2840 28th St N, Superior, WI 54880. Pending motion to vacate -- motion for entry of judgment on Counts 1 & 4 is granted. Judgment will be entered on Counts 1 & 4. State commenting on bail: placed on Probation out of Douglas Co, State asking for $500.00 cash bail since Judgment has been entered. Attorney asking for a signature bond. Def is indigient. Court orders: $300.00, ABSOL, No possession of drug para, N/C w/ N.K., M.P. and N/C with 75781 Pohl Rd. Attorney is not objecting to condition. If Def fails to appear in court, a warrant will be entered and bail forfeited. All parties can appear via Douglas Co Conference Bridge Line.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2021 at 08:00 am.

Bail/bond hearing on June 28, 2021 at 01:00 pm.
Payment Plan

11:45 AM Defendant David James Pepper in court with attorney Jennifer Gross.  Defendant David James Pepper in custody.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Heidi Thimm appeard for the State. ALL PARTIES APPEARING BY PHONE - CONFERENCE BRIDGE. 15CM99 - Here for a BH, Atty Gross comments and is req a BBH to quash warrant. Ct questions will Ash Co come and ge him? State comments yes, Ashland Co will want to go get him. Ct - Seems awkward to quash warrant; never done a BH on a person in another jurisdiction. Ct orders warrant stays active and Ash Co come get him if necessary, if resolved can have another hrng like this. Judge McKnight has not ruled on MO to terminate DEJ. State comments. Ct orders warrant stays in affect, once Mr. Pepper is in Ashland Co. can deal with the warrant then. Atty Gross comments def may want a diff atty, def comments does want Atty Gross as his atty. Ct will do nothing more with this case until Mr. Pepper posts cash bail and/or brought to Ashland County by law enforcment.
Def will be brought to Douglas Co Courthouse for bail hearing. Conference bridge line is 701-802-5131  Access Code 2004250. Clerk and DA to call in to conference bridge.
